Principles of Joining\n 1.The endings -ure and -ual are typically represented by the letters ‘r’ and ‘l,’ unless a downstroke appears before those endings.

To write these combinations correctly:
 
• a. Ensure the o hock remains narrow, making sure the start and end are level with the writing, as shown by the dotted line. 
• b. Keep the ‘o’ in on and sho aligned parallel with the consonant, following the dotted line. 
• c. Let the beginning of the ‘o’ in non retrace the end of the first ‘n.’ 
• d. Avoid forming a point at the curved section marked by the arrows.
Of, know, low, own, home, hot, known, moan, shown.

To write these combinations accurately:/n /n• a. Make the ‘oo’ hook narrow and deep. /n• b. Ensure both the start and end of the hook are on the same level as the rest of the writing. /n• c. In noo and noom, keep the hook parallel to the straight line that comes before it. /n• d. In noom, retrace the beginning of the ‘m’ at the bottom of the ‘oo’ hook. /n• e. Avoid forming a point at the locations marked by arrows.
You, yours truly, you would, to, do, noon, moon, renew.

To write these combinations accurately:
 
• a. Lift the end of the ‘r’ and the end of the ‘l’ upward. 
• b. Avoid lifting the end too early, or the strokes might resemble the ‘nd’ or ‘md’ combinations.
Neared, feared, cheered, dared, hold, sold, bold.
